<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">The <add place="above" hand="typewriter">titles</add> xxxxxxx of the Essays 
            <choice>
              <sic>enumaerate</sic>
              <corr>enumerate</corr>
            </choice> <add hand="ms" place="above">the [illeg.]</add> of those topics.</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">"Of Truth. Of Death. Of Unity in religion. Of Revenge.</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">Of Simulation and 
            <choice>
              <sic>Dissumlation</sic>
              <corr>Dissimulation</corr>
            </choice>." These were the subjects</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">that the rulers discussed at their high tables;</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">and the play was a diversion with which to relax the mind</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">after serious work. The sediment of that conversation is</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">to be found in the rich deposits of the essays. He is concern</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">with the great world of action; with government; with the</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">tortuous matures of Princes; with the arts by which Princes</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">can 
            <choice>
              <sic>way</sic>
              <corr>sway</corr>
            </choice>, can coax, can suppress. He lives entirely</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">in the world of great spirits and great business. The common</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">
            <choice>
              <sic>peopl</sic>
              <corr>people</corr>
            </choice> is contemptible. <quote source="#" rend="inline">The master of superstition is</quote></l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><quote source="#" rend="inline">
            <choice>
              <sic>t e</sic>
              <corr>the</corr>
            </choice> people."</quote> Praise, <quote>"if it be from the common people,</quote></l>

<quote xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" source="#" rend="inline">
            <l>it is commonly false and naught. The lowest virtues draw</l>
            <l>praise from them; the middle virtues work in them astonish</l>
          </quote>
